instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.I2C_CAM_SDA: What is I2C_CAM_SDA? I2C_CAM_SDA is an SMBUS data line between the webcam and the chip that controls the camera. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - there might be an issue with the camera
threads.message:
the board was liquid damage on <CHIP>U5620</CHIP> and <CHIP>U5800</CHIP>,

an appeal, replaced these components and now the board boots fine. no high fan and no slowdown.

the camera is working fine on photobooth. however, ALS is not working.
The apple dialogistic confirmed "there might be an issue with the camera"

the camera connector looks great under a microscope. also tested with another known working display assembly.



diode mode reading on J4002
--------------------------------------------------------------------
<SIGNAL>MIPI_CLK_CONN_N</SIGNAL> pin2 0.397
<SIGNAL>MIPI_CLK_CONN_P</SIGNAL> pin3 0.397
<SIGNAL>MIPI_DATA_CONN_N</SIGNAL> pin5 0.401
<SIGNAL>MIPI_DATA_CONN_P</SIGNAL> pin6 0.399
<SIGNAL>SMCBUS_SMC1_S0_SDA</SIGNAL> pin8 0.737 (0.507 on known working board)
<SIGNAL>SMCBUS_SMC1_S0_SCL</SIGNAL> pin9 0.739 (0.509 on known working board)
<SIGNAL>I2C_CAM_SDA</SIGNAL> pin10 0.725
<SIGNAL>I2C_CAM_SDA</SIGNAL> pin11 0.726
PP5V pin12 0.434 (5v is present)

---------------------------------------------------------------------

this is an SMC problem right,??
cant be <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> since the camera is working. does SMBus talk to <CHIP>U3900</CHIP>??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - there might be an issue with the camera
threads.message:
mmm, think i've found the problem.

I've removed <CHIP>U5620</CHIP>, pin9 and pin10 has no continuity to <CHIP>U5800</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - there might be an issue with the camera
threads.message:
fixed

<CHIP>U5800</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - there might be an issue with the camera
threads.message: what glue did you use? still looking for something which fixes fast enough but does not glue my fingers together like cyanoacrylate

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - there might be an issue with the camera
threads.message:
thick uv glue, known as fishing glue. i used that stuff to make my own smc edge bonding. I'll try to get a photo tomorrow.
the texture is very similar as original edge bonding for the SMC and CPU. takes a couple of seconds to cure with a uv light.

[URL="https://www.aliexpress.com/item/32777256158.html?spm=a2g0s.9042311.0.0.27424c4dgJRPBT"]https://www.aliexpress.com/item/3277...27424c4dgJRPBT[/URL]
